title: Is everyone an idiot in their own special stupid way? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Of course not but to me it happens sometimes that I sometimes explain an opinion like a rant and then get it deleted no matter what. When I explain a simple thing that everyone knows but still get my comment removed because people didn’t want to understand. This would make much more sense if I told what happened but I don’t expect anyone to understand that there are extremists in every group of people. I have seen many answers here on Quora which have explained that many times. I’ll hope this is inside the limits of BNBR rules and I don’t mean to violate those rules but if I get my comment removed because a person didn’t like me disliking liberal extremist then yeah. But no, people aren’t idiots. Some people just can’t see further than the tip of their nose. Eivät näe nenäänsä pidemmälle is what we Finns use as a saying when someone doesn’t accept the obvious.

All humans make stupid mistakes (decision making errors) but at different levels and different frequencies because the cause of this problem and the influence of the environment in which they occur is very variable (low intelligence, ignorance, cognitive biases, other). Therefore, I would say yes, every one is a stupid in their own special way. “The human being, in my concept, is not stupid, he only does stupid things” (István Ráth-Végh. 1870-1950). "In general, a stupid person, is the human at the time of committing stupidity, the rest of the time is a normal person, potentially stupid." Kuke Lito, 2018.
